p: The experiment was conducted in the greenhouse of the Faculty of Agricultural and Food Sciences of the Holy Spirit University of Kaslik (USEK) during the summer season of 2017. The greenhouse is located on the rooftop of the faculty, equipped by an automatic irrigation system that irrigates twice daily and by a ventilation system to regulate the temperature and humidity to the optimal level (25 Â°C, 70%). Aerial parts of Origanum syriacum L. was used in this study obtained from a farmer from south Lebanon. The botanical identification of plant sample was carried out by Marc El Beyrouthy according to the New Flora of Lebanon and Syria as described by [ 24]. A voucher specimen was deposited in the Herbarium of the Faculty of Agricultural and Food Sciences of the Holy Spirit University of Kaslik (USEK), Lebanon, under the registry number MNIII185.
